item.title: 2004 Venus Transit
item.description: 2004-06-08. A transit of Venus across the Sun. Taken by putting an Olympus Digital Camera up to the eyepiece of the Questar 3.5-inch with a continuum Solar filter.
item.media:description: 2004-06-08. A transit of Venus across the Sun. Taken by putting an Olympus Digital Camera up to the eyepiece of the Questar 3.5-inch with a continuum Solar filter.

item.title: Sun and Clouds GIF
item.description: 2011-11-08. Click this image to view a GIF movie of the Sun and clouds passing by.
item.media:description: 2011-11-08. Click this image to view a GIF movie of the Sun and clouds passing by.

item.title: Sun and Sunspots
item.description: 2011-11-08. A still image of the Sun with several sunspots visible.
item.media:description: 2011-11-08. A still image of the Sun with several sunspots visible.

item.title: Sun and Sunspots
item.description: 2011-11-08. Another view of the Sun with several sunspots.
item.media:description: 2011-11-08. Another view of the Sun with several sunspots.

item.title: Sun Projection
item.description: 2011-11-08. An image showing how many of ONU's solar images are taken, by projecting the image from a telescope onto a flat background.
item.media:description: 2011-11-08. An image showing how many of ONU's solar images are taken, by projecting the image from a telescope onto a flat background.

item.title: 2012 Venus Transit
item.description: 2012-06-05. Another transit of venus across the Sun (top left), partially obscured by clouds.
item.media:description: 2012-06-05. Another transit of venus across the Sun (top left), partially obscured by clouds.

item.title: 2012 Venus Transit
item.description: 2012-06-05. A clearer image of the 2012 Venus Transit.
item.media:description: 2012-06-05. A clearer image of the 2012 Venus Transit.

item.title: 2012 Venus Transit
item.description: 2012-06-05. An image showing Venus and several sunspots. What appears to be granular detail is more likely noise.
item.media:description: 2012-06-05. An image showing Venus and several sunspots. What appears to be granular detail is more likely noise.

item.title: The Sun
item.description: 2015-07-16. A image of the sun, without any visible sunspots. The large marks on the image are dust motes on the camera rather than solar features.
item.media:description: 2015-07-16. A image of the sun, without any visible sunspots. The large marks on the image are dust motes on the camera rather than solar features.

item.title: Sunspot Video
item.description: 2016-01-29. Click to view an MP4 video of a sunspot moving across the surface of the Sun.
item.media:description: 2016-01-29. Click to view an MP4 video of a sunspot moving across the surface of the Sun.

item.title: Solar Prominence
item.description: 2016-03-08. This still image through a Hydrogen-alpha (656.3 nm) filter on the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence (bottom right). Brightened for increased visibility.
item.media:description: 2016-03-08. This still image through a Hydrogen-alpha (656.3 nm) filter on the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence (bottom right). Brightened for increased visibility.

item.title: Solar Prominence
item.description: 2016-03-08. This still image also shows the same prominence as the previous image.
item.media:description: 2016-03-08. This still image also shows the same prominence as the previous image.

item.title: Sun Movie
item.description: 2017-06-02. Click to view this movie of several stills covering the entire solar disk.
item.media:description: 2017-06-02. Click to view this movie of several stills covering the entire solar disk.

item.title: Solar Mottling
item.description: 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows some visible mottling along with a sunspot.
item.media:description: 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows some visible mottling along with a sunspot.

item.title: Solar Prominence
item.description: 2017-07-08. This 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence (top right).
item.media:description: 2017-07-08. This 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence (top right).

item.title: Prominence & Mottling
item.description: 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence and mottling.
item.media:description: 2017-07-08. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows a solar prominence and mottling.

item.title: The Sun
item.description: 2019-05-14. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows the majority of the solar disk. This image was created by stacking multiple frames from a video - some alignment imperfections persist on the edges of the image.
item.media:description: 2019-05-14. This H-alpha image taken with the Coronado Solarmax telescope shows the majority of the solar disk. This image was created by stacking multiple frames from a video - some alignment imperfections persist on the edges of the image.
